title: Trump’s new target: Microsoft head of global affairs Lisa Monaco
summary:
is a senior editor and founding member of The Verge who covers gadgets, games, and toys.
Posts from this author will be added to your daily email digest and your homepage feed.
After successfully manipulating Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan and eventually failing to cancel Jimmy Kimmel, President Donald Trump has named his next target for retribution: Microsoft head of global affairs Lisa Monaco.
Trump writes that he’s already stripped Monaco of security clearances, but suggests that her role at Microsoft now lets her access “Highly Sensitive Information.”Image: Truth SocialIt’s not clear why Trump took this moment to go after Monaco, but it’s possible he’s just now becoming aware of her Microsoft role.
Microsoft declined to comment on this story to The Verge.

title: Airports in Denmark Shut Down as Mysterious Drones Spotted
summary:
Denmark is on edge after mysterious drones were spotted above four airports across the country late Wednesday and early Thursday.
At least five Danish airports saw the drones overnight, including at Aalborg and Billund airports, which had to close for hours, according to the BBC.
Skrydstrup air base, where at least one drone was also spotted, is home to F-35 and F-16.
Denmark has told NATO allies that “state actors” were behind the drone incursions, according to Reuters, but it’s unclear whether they’ve definitively identified Russia yet.
President Trump promised to end the war between Russia and Ukraine before he even took office, but has obviously failed to deliver.

title: Trump UN speech: Seven years ago his audience laughed, this year they were silent
summary:
Over almost an hour, he took aim at his opponents and their ideas, picking them off one by one as he toured the world.
The president even attacked the UN for a broken escalator and teleprompter that disrupted his visit and speech.
Under Trump, the US has withdrawn much of its UN funding, leaving the body forced to cut its humanitarian work around the world.
Trump saved perhaps his biggest criticism for his European allies, attacking the continent for investing in renewable energy, and opening its borders to migration.
Watch: How Trump lashed out at Europe in his UN speech

title: Trump calls for the firing of Microsoft's president of global affairs, Lisa Monaco
summary:
Trump calls for the firing of Microsoft's head of global affairs, Lisa Monaco, who is the former deputy attorney general in the Biden administration.

Impact LinkPresident Donald Trump called for the firing of Microsoft's president of global affairs, Lisa Monaco, on Friday.
According to her LinkedIn profile, she started her position as the head of Global Affairs at Microsoft in July.

title: Zelenskyy praises 'well-informed' Trump after president's Russia war pivot
summary:
President Donald Trump meets with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy during the 80th United Nations General Assembly, in New York City, September 23, 2025.
President Donald Trump meets with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy during the 80th United Nations General Assembly, in New York City, September 23, 2025.
"The president clearly understands the situation and is well informed about all aspects of this war," Zelenskyy added.
Asked if the social media post by Trump is a "game changer" for the war, Zelenskyy responded: "Trump is a game changer by himself."
President Donald Trump meets with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during the 80th United Nations General Assembly, in New York City, New York City, September 23, 2025.

title: Xiaomi’s retro handheld phone case is the best, and worst, way to game
summary:
Then oh boy, does Xiaomi have the phone for you.
Today it announced its flagship 17 series phones in China, led by the 17 Pro and 17 Pro Max (any naming similarity to Apple is resolutely not a coincidence).
It can be used to frame selfies, set timers, and control music playback, but all I can think about is Xiaomi’s official accessory to convert the phone into a ratchet Game Boy.
No word yet on if, or when, the 17 Pro phones will launch in Europe or anywhere else outside China, but let’s hope the retro case comes with them when they do.
Maybe this is a sign that the mad scientists in Xiaomi’s accessory lab are cooking up something even weirder for the fourth-generation photography case for next year’s 17 Ultra.

title: Nothing spins off its budget brand CMF
summary:
Posts from this author will be added to your daily email digest and your homepage feed.
Nothing has announced that it plans to spin off its sub-brand CMF, which focuses on cheaper smartphones, earbuds, and wearables, into a standalone subsidiary based in India.
Nothing can afford the investment, having just raised $200 million in a funding round that values the company at $1.3 billion.
The announcement comes at an interesting time for CMF, which is busy teasing the launch of its first pair of over-ear headphones on September 29th.
Like all CMF products, they’re expected to be budget-friendly — its top smartphone, the Phone 2 Pro, is just $279 in its US beta release, with its watches and earbuds all below $100.

title: Germany's first permanent brigade abroad since WWII built its war kit for NATO's eastern edge by watching Ukraine
summary:
The Puma S1 infantry fighting vehicle is among the assets the German brigade is bringing to Lithuania.
Germany is permanently deploying a combat brigade abroad to NATO's vulnerable eastern edge for the first time since World War II amid growing concerns about Russian aggression.
German soldiers walk in Lithuania at a ceremonial roll call to mark Germany's 45th Armoured Brigade being inaugurated in the country.
Ukraine has needed air defense systems, like the US-made Patriot, and the West has learned it needs more.
Raytheon"We will really need a lot of air defense assets, in particular for us as an army unit, short-range air defense," he said.
